alert.note: Alert for Bossier; Caddo; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 1:15PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Webster, central De Soto, northwestern Red River, southeastern Caddo and southern Bossier Parishes through 200 PM CST... At 115 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greenwood to near Joaquin. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Mansfield, Haughton, Stonewall, Sibley, Doyline, Fosters, Keachi, Grand Cane, Longstreet, Keat Chie, Carmel, Curtis, Bodcau, Kingston, Plum Orchard Landing, Koran, Ninock and Kickapoo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
